org.dynalang.dynalink

Interface RelinkableCallSite

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractRelinkableCallSite, MonomorphicCallSite

    public interface RelinkableCallSite
    Interface for relinkable call sites. Language runtimes wishing to use this framework must use subclasses of CallSite that also implement this interface as their call sites. There is a readily usable MonomorphicCallSite subclass that implements monomorphic inline caching strategy.
    Version:
    $Id: $
    Author:
    Attila Szegedi

      void setGuardedInvocation(GuardedInvocation guardedInvocation)
      This method will be called once by the dynamic linker every time the call site is relinked.
      void setRelink(MethodHandle relink)
      Sets the relink method.

    • Method Detail

      • setRelink

        void setRelink(MethodHandle relink)
        Sets the relink method. This is a method matching the method type of the call site that will try to discover the adequate target for the invocation and then subsequently invoke setGuardedInvocation(GuardedInvocation). This method is normally only called by the DynamicLinker implementation.
        Parameters:
        relink - the relink method handle.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the relink is null
        IllegalStateException - if the method was already called

      • getDescriptor

        CallSiteDescriptor getDescriptor()
        Returns the descriptor for this call site.
        Returns:
        the descriptor for this call site.

      • getCallSiteDescriptor

        @Deprecated
CallSiteDescriptor getCallSiteDescriptor()
        Deprecated. use getDescriptor() instead.
        Returns the descriptor for this call site.
        Returns:
        the descriptor for this call site.

      • setGuardedInvocation

        void setGuardedInvocation(GuardedInvocation guardedInvocation)
        This method will be called once by the dynamic linker every time the call site is relinked.
        Parameters:
        guardedInvocation - the guarded invocation that the call site should set as its current target. Note that the call sites are allowed to keep other non-invalidated invocations around for implementation of polymorphic inline caches.
